bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 199 (Tuesday, November 24, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. KRISHNAMOORTHI:H.R. 8814.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section I of the Constitution[Page H6019]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select).

summary.text:
Geospatial Partnership for Security Act of 2020 or the GPS Act

This bill authorizes for FY2021 National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency activities to partner with and provide support to commercial geospatial, open source, and emerging space companies.

bill.title: GPS Act

item.title: Geospatial Partnership for Security Act of 2020
To authorize appropriations to the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency to provide support for commercial geospatial, open source, and emerging space companies, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
